column5: Been out about 30 minutes mostly around hickory beach but just ran shoreline at ThurstonIA around 100 ft up knocked my emptys off the table hoping everyone ok

Saw something about 4 people in a capsized canoe in the Kawarthas and 2 missing.  edit: http://www.msn.com/en-ca/news/canada/2-toronto-men-missing-after-canoe-capsizes-in-kawartha-lakes/ar-AAsIzL3?li=AAggNb9
No life jackets, 4 in a canoe, at 230 am?? What the hell were they doing out there?

Update:  http://www.cp24.com/mobile/news/body-pulled-from-water-in-search-for-missing-gta-boaters-on-sturgeon-lake-1.3614609  One body found. RIP.  Not wearing that PFD turned out to be a costly mistake. Very unfortunate for those left behind.
gonna guess alcohol was involved or a few were non swimmers. such needless deaths (presuming they're going to find the second body) and probably young with their future before them...

Alcohol, bullet proof youthfulness and water late at night. A formula for disaster. I think we can all say we've been there done that at least once when we were unstoppable and young.  Condolences to the unfortunate friends and family. A waste of life, just a waste, tragic. It will happen again unfortunately, and probably sooner than later.
Yep, been there  Tragedy for sure. I feel for those that lost.

I'd say we all have things we look back on and shake our heads about. I sure as heck do. Some of us survive and unfortunately, some become stats. It's just a shame when it does turn tragic and young lives are lost. Those left behind will never be the same.
I totally agree with O I and Grimsbylander. That could have been me when I was young and unstoppable. My condolences to all the familys.
